conclusion: The shadows are cast directly below the objects due to the light source being above them.
As the light source moves forward, it will be closer to the objects, causing the shadows to move closer to the objects as well.
The size of the shadow is determined by the distance between the object and the light source.
When the light source moves forward, the distance between the light source and each object decreases.
This decrease in distance will result in larger shadows because the light rays will spread out more over the same area on the ground.

Shadow C will move closer to the object and become larger.

As the light source moves forward, it gets closer to the objects.
